article.text: Leaders at the Arab League summit on Syria in Iraq last month. [AFP] Last Updated: Thu, 5 Apr 2012 23:59:00 +1000 The United Nations Security Council has agreed to a statement calling upon Syria to comply with an April 10 deadline to halt fighting.It also contains a call for the Syrian government to withdraw its forces from population centres in the country. UN envoy to the Arab League, Kofi Annan, told the council this week the Syrian government had accepted the deadline.He said he would push for an end of rebel operations within 48 hours after the government stops fighting. Mr Annan had asked the council to support the deadline.
